TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Table

Docs.summary: Represents a single table.

remarks.para: The Table object is a member of the collection. The Tables collection includes all the tables in the specified selection, range, or document.
Use Tables(), where is the index number, to return a single Table object. The index number represents the position of the table in the selection, range, or document.
Use the method to add a table at the specified range.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowAutoFit { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Allows Microsoft Word to automatically resize cells in a table to fit their contents.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowPageBreaks { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Allows Microsoft Word to break the specified table across pages.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the Microsoft Word application.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ApplyStyleColumnBands { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean that represents whether to apply style bands to the columns in a table if an applied preset table style provides style banding for columns. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ApplyStyleDirectFormatting([in]string StyleName) runtime managed

Docs.param: The name of the style to apply.
Docs.summary: Applies the specified style but maintains any formatting that a user directly applies.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ApplyStyleFirstColumn { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True for Microsoft Word to apply first-column formatting to the first column of the specified table.

remarks.para: The specified table style must contain first-column formatting in order to apply this formatting to a table.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ApplyStyleHeadingRows { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True for Microsoft Word to apply heading-row formatting to the first row of the selected table.

remarks.para: The specified table style must contain heading-row formatting in order to apply this formatting to a table.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ApplyStyleLastColumn { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True for Microsoft Word to apply last-column formatting to the last column of the specified table.

remarks.para: The specified table style must contain last-column formatting in order to apply this formatting to a table.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ApplyStyleLastRow { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True for Microsoft Word to apply last-row formatting to the last row of the specified table.

remarks.para: The specified table style must contain last-row formatting in order to apply this formatting to a table.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ApplyStyleRowBands { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean that represents whether to apply style bands to the rows in a table if an applied preset table style provides style banding for rows. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AutoFitBehavior([in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdAutoFitBehavior Behavior) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required . How Word resizes the specified table with the AutoFit feature is used.Can be one of these WdAutoFitBehavior constants: wdAutoFitContentwdAutoFitWindowwdAutoFitFixed
Docs.summary: Determines how Microsoft Word resizes a table when the AutoFit feature is used.

remarks.para: Word can resize the table based on the content of the table cells or the width of the document window. You can also use this method to turn off AutoFit so that the table size is fixed, regardless of cell contents or window width.

Setting the AutoFit behavior to wdAutoFitContent or wdAutoFitWindow sets the property to True if it's currently False. Likewise, setting the AutoFit behavior to wdAutoFitFixed sets the AllowAutoFit property to False if it's currently True.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AutoFormat (ref object Format, ref object ApplyBorders, ref object ApplyShading, ref object ApplyFont, ref object ApplyColor, ref object ApplyHeadingRows, ref object ApplyLastRow, ref object ApplyFirstColumn, ref object ApplyLastColumn, ref object AutoFit);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AutoFormat([in]object& Format, [in]object& ApplyBorders, [in]object& ApplyShading, [in]object& ApplyFont, [in]object& ApplyColor, [in]object& ApplyHeadingRows, [in]object& ApplyLastRow, [in]object& ApplyFirstColumn, [in]object& ApplyLastColumn, [in]object& AutoFit) runtime managed

Public Sub AutoFormat (Optional ByRef Format As Object, Optional ByRef ApplyBorders As Object, Optional ByRef ApplyShading As Object, Optional ByRef ApplyFont As Object, Optional ByRef ApplyColor As Object, Optional ByRef ApplyHeadingRows As Object, Optional ByRef ApplyLastRow As Object, Optional ByRef ApplyFirstColumn As Object, Optional ByRef ApplyLastColumn As Object, Optional ByRef AutoFit As Object)

Docs.param: Optional Object.
Optional Object. True to apply the border properties of the specified format. The default value is True.
Optional Object. True to apply the shading properties of the specified format. The default value is True.
Optional Object. True to apply the font properties of the specified format. The default value is True.
Optional Object. True to apply the color properties of the specified format. The default value is True.
Optional Object. True to apply the heading-row properties of the specified format. The default value is True.
Optional Object. True to apply the last-row properties of the specified format. The default value is False.
Optional Object. True to apply the first-column properties of the specified format. The default value is True.
Optional Object. True to apply the last-column properties of the specified format. The default value is False.
Optional Object. True to decrease the width of the table columns as much as possible without changing the way text wraps in the cells. The default value is True.
Docs.summary: Applies a predefined look to a table.

remarks.para: The arguments for this method correspond to the options in the Table AutoFormat dialog box (Table menu).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AutoFormatType As Integer
public: property int AutoFormatType { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the type of automatic formatting that's been applied to the specified table.

remarks.para: The AutoFormatType property can be any constant.
Use the method to apply automatic formatting to a table.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Borders ^ Borders { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Borders ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Borders ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents all the borders for the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float BottomPadding { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the amount of space (in points) to add below the contents of a single cell or all the cells in a table.

remarks.para: The setting of the BottomPadding property for a single cell overrides the setting of the BottomPadding property for the entire table.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Cell Cell (int Row, int Column);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Cell Cell([in]int32 Row, [in]int32 Column) runtime managed
Public Function Cell (Row As Integer, Column As Integer) As Cell
public: Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Cell ^ Cell(int Row, int Column);

Docs.param: Required Integer. The number of the row in the table to return. Can be an integer between 1 and the number of rows in the table.
Required Integer. The number of the cell in the table to return. Can be an integer between 1 and the number of columns in the table.
Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents a cell in a table.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Columns As Columns
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Columns ^ Columns { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Columns ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents all the table columns in the table.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range ConvertToText (ref object Separator, ref object NestedTables);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range ConvertToText([in]object& Separator, [in]object& NestedTables) runtime managed
Public Function ConvertToText (Optional ByRef Separator As Object, Optional ByRef NestedTables As Object) As Range

Docs.param: Optional Object. The character that delimits the converted columns (paragraph marks delimit the converted rows). Can be any following constants.wdSeparateByCommas wdSeparateByDefaultListSeparator wdSeparateByParagraphs wdSeparateByTabs.
Optional Object. True if nested tables are converted to text. This argument is ignored if is not wdSeparateByParagraphs. The default value is True.
Docs.summary: Converts a table to text and returns a object that represents the delimited text.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range ConvertToTextOld([in]object& Separator) runtime managed
Public Function ConvertToTextOld (Optional ByRef Separator As Object) As Range

Docs.param: To be added.
Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Delete() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Deletes the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Descr { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a string that contains a description for the specified table.
Docs.value: A description for the specified table.

remarks.para: Read/write. Use this property to provide an alternative text description for a table. This property adds text to the Description text box on the Alt Text tab of the Table Properties dialog box in Microsoft Word 2010.

Caution: Web browsers display alternative text while tables are loading or if they are missing. Web search engines use the alternative text to help find Web pages. Alternative text is also used to assist disabilities.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ID { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the identifying label for the specified object when the current document is saved as a Web page.

remarks.para: With the exception of the object, you can use a label as a hyperlink reference from other Web pages or from within the current document.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float LeftPadding { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the amount of space (in points) to add to the left of the contents of a single cell or all the cells in a table.

remarks.para: The setting of the LeftPadding property for a single cell overrides the setting of the LeftPadding property for the entire table.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property NestingLevel As Integer
public: property int NestingLevel { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the nesting level of the specified table.

remarks.para: The outermost table has a nesting level of 1. The nesting level of each successively nested table is one higher than the previous table.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the parent object of the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float PreferredWidth { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the preferred width (in points or as a percentage of the window width) for the specified cell, cells, columns, or table.

remarks.para: If the property is set to wdPreferredWidthPoints, the PreferredWidth property returns or sets the width in points. If the PreferredWidthType property is set to wdPreferredWidthPercent, the PreferredWidth property returns or sets the width as a percentage of the window width.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdPreferredWidthType PreferredWidthType { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdPreferredWidthType get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdPreferredWidthType value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the preferred unit of measurement to use for the width of the specified table.

remarks.para: can be one of these WdPreferredWidthType constants:

MemberSignature.Value: Default Public ReadOnly Property Range As Range
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Range ^ default { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Range ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the portion of a document that's contained in the specified object.

remarks.para: For information about returning a range from a document or returning a shape range from a collection of shapes, see the method.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float RightPadding { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the amount of space (in points) to add to the right of the contents of a single cell or all the cells in a table.

remarks.para: The setting of the RightPadding property for a single cell overrides the setting of the RightPadding property for the entire table.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Rows As Rows
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Rows ^ Rows { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Rows ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents all the table rows in a table.

Docs.summary: Selects the specified object.

remarks.para: After using this method, use the property to work with the selected items.

public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Shading ^ Shading { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Shading ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that refers to the shading formatting for the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Sort (ref object ExcludeHeader, ref object FieldNumber, ref object SortFieldType, ref object SortOrder, ref object FieldNumber2, ref object SortFieldType2, ref object SortOrder2, ref object FieldNumber3, ref object SortFieldType3, ref object SortOrder3, ref object CaseSensitive, ref object BidiSort, ref object IgnoreThe, ref object IgnoreKashida, ref object IgnoreDiacritics, ref object IgnoreHe, ref object LanguageID);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Sort([in]object& ExcludeHeader, [in]object& FieldNumber, [in]object& SortFieldType, [in]object& SortOrder, [in]object& FieldNumber2, [in]object& SortFieldType2, [in]object& SortOrder2, [in]object& FieldNumber3, [in]object& SortFieldType3, [in]object& SortOrder3, [in]object& CaseSensitive, [in]object& BidiSort, [in]object& IgnoreThe, [in]object& IgnoreKashida, [in]object& IgnoreDiacritics, [in]object& IgnoreHe, [in]object& LanguageID) runtime managed

Public Sub Sort (Optional ByRef ExcludeHeader As Object, Optional ByRef FieldNumber As Object, Optional ByRef SortFieldType As Object, Optional ByRef SortOrder As Object, Optional ByRef FieldNumber2 As Object, Optional ByRef SortFieldType2 As Object, Optional ByRef SortOrder2 As Object, Optional ByRef FieldNumber3 As Object, Optional ByRef SortFieldType3 As Object, Optional ByRef SortOrder3 As Object, Optional ByRef CaseSensitive As Object, Optional ByRef BidiSort As Object, Optional ByRef IgnoreThe As Object, Optional ByRef IgnoreKashida As Object, Optional ByRef IgnoreDiacritics As Object, Optional ByRef IgnoreHe As Object, Optional ByRef LanguageID As Object)

Docs.param: Optional Object. True to exclude the first row or paragraph header from the sort operation. The default value is False.
Optional Object. The fields to sort by. Microsoft Word sorts by , then by , and then by .

Optional Object. The respective sort types for , , and . Can be one of the following constants.wdSortFieldAlphanumeric wdSortFieldDate wdSortFieldJapanJIS wdSortFieldKoreaKS wdSortFieldNumeric wdSortFieldStroke wdSortFieldSyllable
Optional Object. The sorting order to use when sorting , , and . Can be one of the following constants.wdSortOrderAscendingwdSortOrderDescending
Optional Object. The fields to sort by. Word sorts by , then by , and then by .

Optional Object. The respective sort types for , , and . Can be one of the following constants.wdSortFieldAlphanumeric wdSortFieldDate wdSortFieldJapanJIS wdSortFieldKoreaKS wdSortFieldNumeric wdSortFieldStroke wdSortFieldSyllable
Optional Object. The sorting order to use when sorting , , and . Can be one of the following constants.wdSortOrderAscendingwdSortOrderDescending
Optional Object. The fields to sort by. Microsoft Word sorts by , then by , and then by .

Optional Object. The respective sort types for , , and . Can be one of the following constants:wdSortFieldAlphanumeric wdSortFieldDate wdSortFieldJapanJIS wdSortFieldKoreaKS wdSortFieldNumeric wdSortFieldStroke wdSortFieldSyllable
Optional Object. The sorting order to use when sorting , , and . Can be one of the following constants.wdSortOrderAscendingwdSortOrderDescending
Optional Object. True to sort with case sensitivity. The default value is False.

Optional Object. True to sort based on right-to-left language rules. This argument may not be available to you, depending on the language support (U.S. English, for example) that you’ve selected or installed.

Optional Object. True to ignore the Arabic character when sorting right-to-left language text. This argument may not be available to you, depending on the language support (U.S. English, for example) that you’ve selected or installed.

Optional Object. True to ignore kashidas when sorting right-to-left language text. This argument may not be available to you, depending on the language support (U.S. English, for example) that you’ve selected or installed.

Optional Object. True to ignore bidirectional control characters when sorting right-to-left language text. This argument may not be available to you, depending on the language support (U.S. English, for example) that you’ve selected or installed.

Optional Object. True to ignore the Hebrew character when sorting right-to-left language text. This argument may not be available to you, depending on the language support (U.S. English, for example) that you’ve selected or installed.
Optional Object. Specifies the sorting language. Can be one of the constants.
Docs.summary: Sorts the specified table.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SortAscending() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Sorts table rows in ascending alphanumeric order.

remarks.para: The first table row is considered a header record and isn't included in the sort. Use the method to include the header record in a sort.
Note This method offers a simplified form of sorting intended for mail merge data sources that contain columns of data. For most sorting tasks, use the method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SortDescending() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Sorts table rows in descending alphanumeric order.

remarks.para: The first paragraph or table row is considered a header record and isn't included in the sort. Use the method to include the header record in a sort.
Note This method offers a simplified form of sorting intended for mail-merge data sources that contain columns of data. For most sorting tasks, use the method.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float Spacing { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the spacing (in points) between the cells in a table.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Table Split([in]object& BeforeRow) runtime managed
Public Function Split (ByRef BeforeRow As Object) As Table

Docs.param: Required Object. The row that the table is to be split before. Can be a row number or a object.
Docs.summary: Inserts an empty paragraph immediately above the specified row in the table, and returns a object that contains both the specified row and the rows that follow it.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ Style { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the style for the specified object.

remarks.para: To set this property, specify the local name of the style, an integer, a constant, or an object that represents the style.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdTableDirection TableDirection { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdTableDirection get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdTableDirection value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the direction in which Microsoft Word orders cells in the specified table.

remarks.para: can be one of the following constants:

If the TableDirection property is set to wdTableDirectionLtr, the selected rows are arranged with the first column in the leftmost position. If the TableDirection property is set to wdTableDirectionRtl, the selected rows are arranged with the first column in the rightmost position.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Tables As Tables
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Tables ^ Tables { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Tables ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents all the tables in the specified table.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Title { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a string that contains a title for the specified table.
Docs.value: A title for the specified table.

remarks.para: Read/write. Use this property to provide an alternative text title for a table. This property adds title text to the Title text box on the Alt Text tab of the Table Properties dialog box in Microsoft Word 2010.

Caution: Web browsers display alternative text while tables are loading or if they are missing. Web search engines use the alternative text to help find Web pages. Alternative text is also used to assist disabilities.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float TopPadding { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the amount of space (in points) to add above the contents of a single cell or all the cells in a table.

remarks.para: The setting of the TopPadding property for a single cell overrides the setting of the TopPadding property for the entire table.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Uniform As Boolean
public: property bool Uniform { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: True if all the rows in a table have the same number of columns.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void UpdateAutoFormat() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Updates the table with the characteristics of a predefined table format.

remarks.para: If you apply a table format with and then insert rows and columns, the table may no longer match the predefined look. UpdateAutoFormat restores the format.
